verses.text: \w Better|strong="H2896"\w* \add is\add* a \w dry|strong="H2720"\w* \w morsel|strong="H6595"\w*, and \w quietness|strong="H7962"\w* therewith, than an \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w full|strong="H4392"\w* of \w sacrifices|strong="H2077"\w* \add with\add* \w strife|strong="H7379"\w*.\f + \fr 17.1 \ft sacrifices: or, good cheer\f*

A \w wise|strong="H7919"\w* \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* shall have \w rule|strong="H4910"\w* over a \w son|strong="H1121"\w* that causeth \w shame|strong="H0954"\w*, and shall have \w part|strong="H2505"\w* of the \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w* \w among|strong="H8432"\w* the \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w*.

The fining \w pot|strong="H4715"\w* \add is\add* for \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and the \w furnace|strong="H3564"\w* for \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*: but the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w trieth|strong="H0974"\w* the \w hearts|strong="H3826"\w*.

A wicked \w doer|strong="H7489"\w* giveth \w heed|strong="H7181"\w* to \w false|strong="H0205"\w* \w lips|strong="H8193"\w*; \add and\add* a \w liar|strong="H8267"\w* giveth \w ear|strong="H0238"\w* to a \w naughty|strong="H1942"\w* \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w*.

Whoso \w mocketh|strong="H3932"\w* the \w poor|strong="H7326"\w* \w reproacheth|strong="H2778"\w* his \w Maker|strong="H6213"\w*: \add and\add* he that is \w glad|strong="H8056"\w* at \w calamities|strong="H0343"\w* shall not be \w unpunished|strong="H5352"\w*.\f + \fr 17.5 \ft unpunished: Heb. held innocent\f*

\w Children’s|strong="H1121"\w* \w children|strong="H1121"\w* \add are\add* the \w crown|strong="H5850"\w* of old \w men|strong="H2205"\w*; and the \w glory|strong="H8597"\w* of \w children|strong="H1121"\w* \add are\add* their \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*.

\w Excellent|strong="H3499"\w* \w speech|strong="H8193"\w* \w becometh|strong="H5000"\w* not a \w fool|strong="H5036"\w*: much less do \w lying|strong="H8267"\w* \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* a \w prince|strong="H5081"\w*.\f + \fr 17.7 \ft Excellent…: Heb. A lip of excellency\f*\f + \fr 17.7 \ft lying…: Heb. a lip of lying\f*

A \w gift|strong="H7810"\w* \add is as\add* a \w precious|strong="H2580"\w* \w stone|strong="H0068"\w* in the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of him that \w hath|strong="H1167"\w* it: whithersoever it \w turneth|strong="H6437"\w*, it \w prospereth|strong="H7919"\w*.\f + \fr 17.8 \ft a precious…: Heb. a stone of grace\f*

He that \w covereth|strong="H3680"\w* a \w transgression|strong="H6588"\w* \w seeketh|strong="H1245"\w* \w love|strong="H0160"\w*; but he that \w repeateth|strong="H8138"\w* a \w matter|strong="H1697"\w* \w separateth|strong="H6504"\w* \add very\add* \w friends|strong="H0441"\w*.\f + \fr 17.9 \ft seeketh: or, procureth\f*

A \w reproof|strong="H1606"\w* \w entereth|strong="H5181"\w* more into a wise \w man|strong="H0995"\w* than an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w stripes|strong="H5221"\w* into a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*.\f + \fr 17.10 \ft entereth…: or, aweth more a wise man, than to strike a fool an hundred times\f*

An \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \add man\add* \w seeketh|strong="H1245"\w* only \w rebellion|strong="H4805"\w*: therefore a \w cruel|strong="H0394"\w* \w messenger|strong="H4397"\w* shall be \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* against him.

Let a \w bear|strong="H1677"\w* \w robbed|strong="H7909"\w* of her whelps \w meet|strong="H6298"\w* a \w man|strong="H0376"\w*, rather \w than|strong="H0408"\w* a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* in his \w folly|strong="H0200"\w*.
Whoso \w rewardeth|strong="H7725"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* for \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* shall not \w depart|strong="H4185"\w* from his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

The \w beginning|strong="H7225"\w* of \w strife|strong="H4066"\w* \add is as\add* when one letteth \w out|strong="H6362"\w* \w water|strong="H4325"\w*: therefore leave \w off|strong="H5203"\w* \w contention|strong="H7379"\w*, \w before|strong="H6440"\w* it be \w meddled|strong="H1566"\w* with.

He that \w justifieth|strong="H6663"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*, and he that \w condemneth|strong="H7561"\w* the \w just|strong="H6662"\w*, even they \w both|strong="H8147"\w* \add are\add* \w abomination|strong="H8441"\w* to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Wherefore \add is there\add* a \w price|strong="H4242"\w* in the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* to \w get|strong="H7069"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, seeing \add he hath\add* no \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \add to it\add*?
A \w friend|strong="H7453"\w* \w loveth|strong="H0157"\w* at all \w times|strong="H6256"\w*, and a \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* is \w born|strong="H3205"\w* for \w adversity|strong="H6869"\w*.

A \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w void|strong="H2638"\w* of \w understanding|strong="H3820"\w* \w striketh|strong="H8628"\w* \w hands|strong="H3709"\w*, \add and\add* \w becometh|strong="H6148"\w* \w surety|strong="H6161"\w* in the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of his \w friend|strong="H7453"\w*.\f + \fr 17.18 \ft understanding: Heb. heart\f*

He \w loveth|strong="H0157"\w* \w transgression|strong="H6588"\w* that \w loveth|strong="H0157"\w* \w strife|strong="H4683"\w*: \add and\add* he that \w exalteth|strong="H1361"\w* his \w gate|strong="H6607"\w* \w seeketh|strong="H1245"\w* \w destruction|strong="H7667"\w*.

He that hath a \w froward|strong="H6141"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \w findeth|strong="H4672"\w* no \w good|strong="H2896"\w*: and he that hath a \w perverse|strong="H2015"\w* \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w* \w falleth|strong="H5307"\w* into \w mischief|strong="H7451"\w*.\f + \fr 17.20 \ft He that hath a froward…: Heb. The froward of heart\f*

He that \w begetteth|strong="H3205"\w* a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* \add doeth it\add* to his \w sorrow|strong="H8424"\w*: and the \w father|strong="H0001"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H5036"\w* hath no \w joy|strong="H8055"\w*.

A \w merry|strong="H8056"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* doeth \w good|strong="H3190"\w* \add like\add* a \w medicine|strong="H1456"\w*: but a \w broken|strong="H5218"\w* \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* \w drieth|strong="H3001"\w* the \w bones|strong="H1634"\w*.\f + \fr 17.22 \ft like: or, to\f*

A \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \add man\add* \w taketh|strong="H3947"\w* a \w gift|strong="H7810"\w* out of the \w bosom|strong="H2436"\w* to \w pervert|strong="H5186"\w* the \w ways|strong="H0734"\w* of \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*.

\w Wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add is\add* before him that hath \w understanding|strong="H6440"\w*; but the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of a \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* \add are\add* in the \w ends|strong="H7097"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.

A \w foolish|strong="H3684"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \add is\add* a \w grief|strong="H3708"\w* to his \w father|strong="H0001"\w*, and \w bitterness|strong="H4470"\w* to her that \w bare|strong="H3205"\w* him.

Also to \w punish|strong="H6064"\w* the \w just|strong="H6662"\w* \add is\add* not \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, \add nor\add* to \w strike|strong="H5221"\w* \w princes|strong="H5081"\w* for \w equity|strong="H3476"\w*.

He that \w hath|strong="H3045"\w* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w* \w spareth|strong="H2820"\w* his \w words|strong="H0561"\w*: \add and\add* a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* of \w understanding|strong="H8394"\w* is of an \w excellent|strong="H3368"\w* \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.\f + \fr 17.27 \ft an…: or, a cool\f*

Even a \w fool|strong="H0191"\w*, when he holdeth his \w peace|strong="H2790"\w*, is \w counted|strong="H2803"\w* \w wise|strong="H2450"\w*: \add and\add* he that \w shutteth|strong="H0331"\w* his \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* \add is esteemed\add* a man of \w understanding|strong="H0995"\w*.
